item.title: Helen add a quote by Richard Adams
item.description: "Animals don't behave like men,' he said. 'If they have to fight, they fight; and if they have to kill they kill. But they don't sit down and set their wits to work to devise ways of spoiling other creatures' lives and hurting them. They have dignity and animality." -- Richard Adams

item.title: Helen add a quote by Wilkie Collins
item.description: "Some of us rush through life, and some of us saunter through life. Mrs. Vesey sat through life." -- Wilkie Collins

item.title: Helen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Helen add a quote by Dorothy Dunnett
item.description: "I wish to God,” said Gideon with mild exasperation, “that you’d talk—just once—in prose like other people." -- Dorothy Dunnett

item.title: Helen add a quote by Susanna Kearsley
item.description: "The past can teach us, nurture us, but it cannot sustain us. The essence of life is change, and we must move ever forward or the soul will wither and die." -- Susanna Kearsley

item.title: Helen add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "That was a memorable day to me, for it made great changes in me. But it is the same with any life. Imagine one selected day struck out of it, and think how different its course would have been. Pause you who read this, and think for a moment of the long chain of iron or gold, of thorns or flowers, that would never have bound you, but for the formation of the first link on one memorable day." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Helen add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "What she was finding also was how one book led to another, doors kept opening wherever she turned and the days weren't long enough for the reading she wanted to do." -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Helen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Yes: I am a dreamer. For a dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Helen add a quote by Jennifer Egan
item.description: "If I had a view like this to look down on every day, I would have the energy and inspiration to conquer the world. The trouble is, when you most need such a view, no one gives it to you." -- Jennifer Egan

item.title: Helen add a quote by Dorothy Dunnett
item.description: "Today,’ said Lymond, ‘if you must know, I don’t like living at all. But that’s just immaturity boggling at the sad face of failure. Tomorrow I’ll be bright as a bedbug again." -- Dorothy Dunnett

item.title: Helen add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Come what come may, time and the hour run through the roughest day." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Helen add a quote by Rafael Sabatini
item.description: "He was born with a gift of laughter and a sense that the world was mad." -- Rafael Sabatini
